timeline.content:
As per your own published policy, bookings cancelled within the 14-day cooling-off period (or 7 days, if applicable) are not subject to any charges. Since I never paid a deposit, did not move in, and cancelled on the day of booking, I am not liable for any payment.

Your attempt to request full payment under these circumstances appears to violate both:

Your own cooling-off and cancellation policy, and
Potentially consumer protection laws relating to unfair contract terms.
I did not receive any services, nor did I agree to waive any cancellation rights. Therefore, I will not be making any payment.

I request that you immediately:

Confirm that my booking has been fully cancelled, and
Confirm that no payment is due.
If this matter is not resolved promptly, I will escalate it to my local consumer protection body and consider legal action if further payment demands continue.

I expect your written confirmation within 48 hours.

transcripts.transcript_text:
Speaker A: Hello.
Speaker B: Hi, Olivia, how are you?
Speaker A: I'm good, thank you. Please.
Speaker B: I'm Sahil. I'm calling you from Amber Student. I have got an inquiry along with the booking form for one of our accommodations. Access LinkedIn.
Speaker A: Yeah, that's right. Yeah.
Speaker B: All right, got it. So can you help me? What are the dates you are looking at?
Speaker A: Ideally I'm looking for any day next week open to open till ideally 29th September, but I don't know whether you've got that long.
Speaker B: Actually all the properties in London especially are only offering the stay till 29th of August. After that a new academic year starts up. So that is the maximum that you know the properties are offering.
Speaker A: So what's the final date?
Speaker B: It's 29th of August.
Speaker A: Yeah. Okay.
Speaker B: But the pricing is really good. I mean till the time you can. I can look at some alternate options for you for a month after that. But this will be a very good price for you at somewhere around 160. 180 a week?
Speaker A: Yeah. It said on the website it was 150 a week.
Speaker B: Exactly. But you see the movement is 25th of July. So that is the pricing for five weeks. If we are looking somewhere around the range of. If you are looking next week then it should be somewhere around 180 a week.
Speaker A: Oh, how come that is the last time?
Speaker B: Sorry?
Speaker A: How come? It's more expensive for less time there.
Speaker B: Actually that is how properties in London work. Typically as the immediate stays, you know the. Usually for summers the pricing is low but in the month of August that goes a tad bit away. But even if all things consider 180 is a steal for this property because this generally sells up at 300.320a week for September.
Speaker A: Yeah. So what would the. The price be for if I was to move in next week? Week up until 29 August. What would the price be?
Speaker B: Can you help me? What is the move in date you are. Sorry? What is the date you are considering?
Speaker A: Ideally, Let me just have a look. Ideally the 4th of August.
Speaker B: I can just check on the pricing for you and I'll update you as soon as possible. Just for your reference, we do not require any deposit. You just get a contract you'll just that you need to sign and you'll just need to pay the advance rent. So it's nothing like that. You'll pay a deposit which will be refunded back later.
Speaker A: Okay.
Speaker B: Yeah. So I'm just checking on the pricing for you and I'll get back to you shortly.
Speaker A: What will you call me back.
Speaker B: Yeah, exactly. I'll call you back. Hopefully 20, 30 minutes itself.
Speaker A: Yeah, that's perfect. Thank you so much for your help, sir.
Speaker B: All right, thank you.
Speaker A: All right, bye.

Speaker A: Hello?
Speaker B: Hello. Yeah, hi. Olivia Sahil, the Saeed again from Ambu.
Speaker A: Hi.
Speaker B: Yep. Perfect. So the pricing is 150 itself.
Speaker A: The price is what, sorry?
Speaker B: 150.
Speaker A: Okay, great.
Speaker B: Yeah, exactly. But please note that we are only left with last two rooms. So if we have to get this room for you, I can request an offer and you can just sign it up. So we can block the room.
Speaker A: Yeah, that would be great. So that's from Monday.
Speaker B: Exactly. Usually contracts in London, they typically start over the weekend. So it can be from today or tomorrow, but it will be prior to. Yeah, I'll try to get it on Monday, but just to give you a heads up on it.
Speaker A: That's brilliant. Thank you so much. What will you do? Give me a call back.
Speaker B: Yeah, exactly. Once offer is sent, I'll give you a call back. I'll run it, the contract through you. So. And I'll explain you the signing process. And it's all done. Will not take more than 20, 30 minutes at max.
Speaker A: Thank you so much. Bye.
Speaker B: All right, thanks. Cheers.

Speaker A: Hello?
Speaker B: Hi, Olivia, how are you?
Speaker A: Hi.
Speaker B: Yes, Sahil, they said can you kindly check your email? I'm calling you from Amber.
Speaker A: Yeah, from Amber. You need my email?
Speaker B: No, no, actually we have sent you the offer over your email. So I just wanted to walk you through it.
Speaker A: Oh, right. Okay. One second. Let me just open my emails.
Speaker B: Yeah, I. Take your time.
Speaker A: I can see it. Yeah. The question.
Speaker B: Yeah, you can just read. Just do one thing, just go through the terms vividly and you can just sign and I'll just verify it for you and then you can make the payment tomorrow. The contract. We have set the contract date from Monday itself and you can check in on Monday at 10:00pm Once you make the payment.
Speaker A: Oh, that's perfect. Right, let me open that. One sec.
Speaker B: Yeah, perfect audience. Take your time.
Speaker A: Start signing.
Speaker B: Exactly.
Speaker A: Amber students, proceed to document.
Speaker B: And after that I'll start looking for another one month accommodation for you. But I need a few days on it. I'll try to get you an extension at AXO itself if it's possible. If not, I'll look at a couple of more different options and I'll send them across.
Speaker A: Oh, that's great. Thank you.
Speaker B: Happy to help.
Speaker A: Right, I think I've signed that now.
Speaker B: You just need to click on finish as well because I'll get an email once you sign it up.
Speaker A: Okay.
Speaker B: Then this will give you the option that the document is completed.
Speaker A: It's bouncing everywhere now.
Speaker B: No worries, take your time.
Speaker A: Ah, finish. Got it. Right, I've signed that.
Speaker B: Has it given you a confirmation if it's signed? Yeah. Perfect. It is signed. I can see it is signed. So our team will now counter sign it up for you basically and you'll get an invoice if you want to pay from a domestic UK bank, I'll recommend you if you. Because you will save a lot on your bank charges and everything. So you can just make a domestic bank transfer and I have left you a WhatsApp messages. Help me with the confirmation receipt of your payment and everything is done. But the room is locked for you.
Speaker A: What do you mean by domestic bank transfer?
Speaker B: So. No, actually the thing is, usually what happens is as you can see, you are a British national. Sometimes international students book these accommodations and they have international accounts. So what I meant was you can just make the transfer from your UK bank to, you know, and the bank details can be found on our contract as well regarding your rent and everything. Or you'll get an invoice from our end as well. You can pay using a card if you prefer. However it Works for you.
Speaker A: That's great, thank you.
Speaker B: All right, perfect. I have left you a message. If you end up making a bank transfer, just help me with that. Confirmation recept, like your inner transfer. Confirmation recept. And everything is done whenever you make the payment, today or tomorrow.
Speaker A: Okay, so the bank details are on the contract.
Speaker B: Exactly. The bank details are on the contract. And you can just. I'll. What I'll do is I'll just send you this contract over your WhatsApp as well, so you can have a look at it. You'll any which way is get a copy over your email.
Speaker A: Okay. Yeah, yeah.
Speaker B: Can you see my message? I've left you a message. I've left you a message over your WhatsApp. You can just check.
Speaker A: Yeah, yeah, I've got that.
Speaker B: Yeah, that's great. I mean, yeah. So, I mean, I'll keep you posted on it. You can always. Yeah, sorry, please go on. I'm sorry.
Speaker A: Yeah, no, it's all right. So I'll wait for the contract to come. Read through that the bank details will be on there. Make the payment tomorrow and it's available from Monday at 10:00, clock exactly.
Speaker B: Just once you make the payment, just help me with the confirmation receipt. So I'll just forward it to the site team at. All done?
Speaker A: Yeah, I will do. Thank you.
Speaker B: All right. Thank you very much, Olivia, and have a lovely weekend. Cheers.
Speaker A: Thank you so much. Bye.
